results.text: You pulled one too many levers or mixed the wrong reagents at the incorrect levels. You produce a small-scale explosion, dealing you [[/r 1d4]] force damage and singing off your eyebrows (which grow back in [[/r 1d4]] months).
Sure there’s a crack here or a frayed rope there, but you’re sure it’s safe! You mis-assess a structure’s overall stability with disastrous results.
There’s something off in your formula and you’re preoccupied with figuring it out. The next time you roll initiative, you are considered surprised for the first round.
In trying to untangle this engineering problem you’ve only succeeded in making it worse. You have disadvantage on your next Engineering check against the target.
One of the tools or implements critical to this check breaks. Increase the amount of time it takes to complete the current task by [[/r 1d4]] minutes, hours, or days, whichever is relevant.
You’ve forgotten a crucial formula or method of construction. You temporarily lose an expertise die to Engineering checks for the next 24 hours.
